Key Match Events: South Africa scored 113/6 in their innings
Bangladesh fell short by 4 runs with a score of 109/7
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa maintained a 100% win-record at the T20 World Cup 2024
Bangladesh will move to the West Indies to play Netherlands and Nepal, with the Super 8s still in sight
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a used wicket
Bangladesh were 50 for 4 after ten overs but managed to recover with a 44-run fifth-wicket partnership
Others: The match was won by South Africa due to a clutch display of death bowling by Taskin Ahmed, Rishad Hossain, and Mustafizur Rahman
Keshav Maharaj was tasked with the final over for the first time in T20Is and sent down three full tosses

The decision to give out Mahmudullah off a ball that hit his front pad and deflected to the boundary for what looked like four leg byes was reviewed and found to be incorrect according to ICC's protocols on DRS (3.7.1)
